review.title: A Dynamic Epistemic Framework for Conformant Planning
review.abstract: In this paper, we introduce a lightweight dynamic epistemic logical framework for automated planning under initial uncertainty. We reduce plan verification and conformant planning to model checking problems of our logic. We show that the model checking problem of the iteration-free fragment is PSPACE-complete. By using two non-standard (but equivalent) semantics, we give novel model checking algorithms to the full language and the iteration-free language.

sections.heading: 5 Conclusions and future work
sections.text: In this thesis, we first introduce the logical language EAL about uncertainty maps and axiomatize it completely. EAL is then extended to EPDL with programs to specify compliant and conditional plans. We show that the compliant planning problems can be reduced to problems of EPDL model verification. Finally, we showed that the model verification of the starless EPDL via uncertainty maps is PSPACE-complete and the model verification of the complete fragment in EXPTIME. Note that our EPDL is a powerful language that can already express conditional plans, for example, (? p; a +? p; b; c). This suggests that we can use the very EPDL language (EPDL − sufficient) to verify plans in conditional planning.
